titleInfo.title: Map of Allardt Land Company property and surrounding area, Upper Cumberland Plateau

mods.abstract: Manuscript map showing south central Kentucky and north central Tennessee, including an area presumed to be the Allardt Land Company property (shown with hatched lines). Map shows towns, creeks, and railroads, including the Tennessee Central Railway, placing the date at no earlier than 1893. Some town names are stamped, some handwritten.

In the late 1800s, Bruno Gernt and M. H. Allardt founded a community of immigrant Germans in the Upper Cumberland Plateau at about the same time the British were settling nearby Rugby. German land agent Gernt envisioned a self-sufficient city here. Gernt sold 9,000 acres owned by the Clarke family of Nebraska in parcels of 25,50, and 200 acres at $4 per acre to farmers, miners, and lumbermen.
